alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin; Inland Franklin; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 12:29PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Wakulla, southeastern Liberty and north central Franklin Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 1229 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 15 miles southeast of Stonemill Creek to 6 miles north of Eastpoint. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... East Camp, Jewel Fire Tower, Poplar Camp, Morgan Place, Smith Creek, Sumatra, High Bluff, Twin Pole, Sanborn, Owens Bridge and Fort Gadsden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
